seg.seg: as it were with the evil fire of enmity. Trusting the gods (were); he alone stood dejected, leaning firmly on the top of the bow [and] thought of enmity. 2. When, thereupon, the Buddha, (the master),
Er [scil. Māra] allein stand (niedergeschlagen) [da], auf die Sehne des Bogens herab(?)gelehnt, [und] dachte an Feindschaft.
He [i.e. Māra] alone stood (despondent), leaning down(?) onto the bowstring [and] thought of enmity.

had come to the throne offering great space and covered on top (?), he stretched up his stout (?), golden-coloured arm, alike to the trunk of the heavenly airāvata(-elephant), [and] with [his] (fingers) adorned with webbed skin

having touched the lower part of the seat soon on the div(ine), eight-qualities (pond) a boat, four-jewelled and provided with the four embodiments (became visible), full to the brim with divine lotus flowers [divine lotuses and flowers?].
In the middle of the ship, in the direction toward the Sumeru, a throne of beryl (became visible) and at the head of the throne, which, with golden ... by a stem of beryl and a ... of silver
with ornaments (?) of diamond [and] jewels, glowed in many ways, a lotus surrounded with the rays of the jewels [and] equipped (with) ... (became) visible.

And on the filament of the lotus, the god of gods, having adopted the paryaṅka[-position], looking like the hood of the Nāga Vāsuki, by the ... surrounded with (rays a fathom wide) as it were, [equipped] with
a straight body, consisting of jewels as it were, and yet being in meditation, became visible. (But how so? ||) ... From the water water-coloured (rays) [and] fire-couloured [ones] from the ...
issued forth, beryl-coloured [ones] from the throne, (but from the lotus [there issued forth] white and gold-coloured [ones] ... sitting in a ...
he at the same time [and] to the highest degree embodied one (sitting (?)) in meditation. 1. ... (like) with the mind ...
This whole earth was covered as it were with heavenly flowers all around. (With) joy (all) the beings saw (the Buddha, god of gods. 2. From) a billion (abodes of the gods,)
Diese ganze Erde wurde förmlich ringsum mit himmlischen Blumen bedeckt.
The whole earth, as it were, was positively covered all around with heavenly flowers.
from a billion sumeru-mountains, gods [and] humans saw ... equally the Buddha. They (all, however), with eyes (without winking, by) the [intense] excitement were [made] happy [and]
pure. The in-between worlds lit up (in) a three-fold way ... 3. As if, (at the summit of the sumeru-mountain ... next to) the pāṇḍukambala-throne, the (heavenly)
Es leuchteten auf die Zwischenwelten (in) dreifacher Weise.
... shone onto the in-between worlds (in) a threefold manner.
pārijāta-tree was standing: equal to this [is] the throne of (the Buddha, god of gods). On the lotus throne the pārijāta-tree of Buddha-hood was visible in an exceedingly lovely way ...
The reason, however, [is] this: There is no god [or] human, (by whom) the crown of the head of the Buddha, god of gods is seen. Therefore all gods [and] humans (see him) from below (to the top).
For the Buddha, the master, sitting on the lotus, was to be seen higher than anything else. But how so? Up above the earth, 16,777,2(7)(6 miles) up high
are the gods of the Akaniṣṭha(dhātu)[-world]. [But] they, too, began to look up at the face of the Buddha, god of gods, from below ...
[Aber] auch sie [scil. die Götter] begannen, von unten nach oben auf das Antlitz des Göttergottes Buddha zu sehen.
[But] they [i.e. the gods] also began to look up to the face of the god of gods, the Buddha, from below.

p.note: The translation is largely based on 28-29, and .

Fragments A 315 and A 316 belong to the same leaf but do not connect. They immediately follow and are immediately followed by . A 315 makes up part of the left side, A 316 follows to the right. Both are included in this entry.

aṣtāṅkopet: 260 suggests to translate 'excellent': “(in a divine) excellent (pond)”, cf. Skt. aṣṭāṅgopeta- 'excellent' (of water, Divyāvadāna, p. 127, l. 19), , aṣṭāṅga-. *kotäk 'embodiment': cf. TB kutk- 'to embody, incarnate, represent' (260).
The gap must have contained the name of a tune with 4x15 syllables, rhythm 7/8.

According to 260 the supplementation (wso)k aṣtre tākar “(they) were made happy and pure” cannot be correct, as one would expect a form wsoke (Nom. Pl. Masc.); instead he suggests to supplement (pu)k 'all'.
